result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Ray Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Ray Williams not in court.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court for Anthony Ray Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 11/9/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Received and Filed. STATES MOTION IN LIMINE
Received and Filed. STATES WITNESS LIST

Defendant Anthony Ray Williams appeared by video.  Attorney Michael V Fuentes appeared by video for Anthony Ray Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. The victim requests the no contact order be modified. State objects. Defense takes no position. Court DENIES the request at this time. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Ray Williams in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Pre-Trial Conference. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference date, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Remaining cash bail posted to be returned to the remitter.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CMM.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Anthony Ray Williams in court.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 29 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Ray Williams
Current: 3066 N 53rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 07-07-2022)
Prior: 3835 North 5th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-7-2022 @1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07/07/2022@1pm
